public class XPath

Extension of NodePath for XmlLite trees.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Constructor Detail

XPath

public XPath(java.lang.String patternString)
Construct with a NodePath pattern.

Constructs a path from a string of the form p1.p2. ... .pN

where pi is of the form:

  • "x" -- matches when x.equals(node.getData().asTag().name) or
  • "x[subscript]" -- matches as for "x" AND the 0-based local sibling index is a member of the comma-delimited list of 'subscript' integers and/or hyphenated ranges or
  • "**" -- matches any "x" down any number of nodes along the path.

Method Detail

getNodes

public java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> getNodes(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Get the nodes that match this xpath starting from the given node.

Note: subscripts are ignored for the first element in the path.

Returns:
the matching node(s) or null.

getFirstNode

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getFirstNode(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node against this xpath.

getNodes

public java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> getNodes(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                   java.lang.String attribute)
Get the nodes that match this xpath and have the given attribute starting from the given node.

Note: subscripts are ignored for the first element in the path.

Parameters:
node - The xml node to start matching this xpath from.
attribute - The attribute that must exist for the node to match. If the attribute is of the form "attribute=value", then the attribute must not only exist, but its value must equal 'value'.
Returns:
the matching node(s) or null.

getFirstNode

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getFirstNode(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                       java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node with the given attribute against this xpath.

Parameters:
node - The xml node to start matching this xpath from.
attribute - The attribute that must exist for the node to match. If the attribute is of the form "attribute=value", then the attribute must not only exist, but its value must equal 'value'.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                boolean all)
Apply this xpath to the given node, extracting the text under each matching node. All text under a matching node is concatenated. Text is trimmed and concatenation adds a single space delimiter between texts.

NOTE: empty text nodes will be ignored.

Parameters:
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
all - If all, get all (deep) text under the node; otherwise, just get text immediately under the node.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty if nodes match, but they contain no (non-empty) text; or the strings of texts found under each matching nodes.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                boolean all,
                                                boolean includeEmpties)
Apply this xpath to the given node, extracting the text under each matching node. All text under a matching node is concatenated. Text is trimmed and concatenation adds a single space delimiter between texts.

Parameters:
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
all - If all, get all (deep) text under the node; otherwise, just get text immediately under the node.
includeEmpties - If true, empty text nodes will appear with empty strings as placeholders; otherwise, empty text nodes will be ignored.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty if nodes match, but they contain no (non-empty) text; or the strings of texts found under each matching nodes.

getFirstText

public java.lang.String getFirstText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node's text.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                java.lang.String attribute,
                                                boolean all)
Apply this xpath to the given node, extracting attribute values from the results matching the given attribute.

NOTE: empty text nodes will be ignored.

Parameters:
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
attribute - The attribute whose values are to be collected.
all - In the case the attribute is of the form att=val, the node's text instead of attribute text will be returned. This parameter specifies whether that should be shallow or deep text.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty list if nodes match and the attribute exists, but is empty; or the attribute values found in matching nodes.

getText

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                                java.lang.String attribute,
                                                boolean all,
                                                boolean includeEmpties)
Apply this xpath to the given node, extracting attribute values from the results matching the given attribute.

Parameters:
node - The node to apply this xpath from.
attribute - The attribute whose values are to be collected.
all - In the case the attribute is of the form att=val, the node's text instead of attribute text will be returned. This parameter specifies whether that should be shallow or deep text.
includeEmpties - If true, empty text nodes will appear with empty strings as placeholders; otherwise, empty text nodes will be ignored.
Returns:
null if no nodes match the pattern; empty list if nodes match and the attribute exists, but is empty; or the attribute values found in matching nodes.

getFirstText

public java.lang.String getFirstText(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node,
                                     java.lang.String attribute)
Convenience method for getting the first matching node's attribute value.

findOrCreateNodes

public java.util.List<Tree<XmlLite.Data>> findOrCreateNodes(Tree<XmlLite.Data> node)
Apply this xpath to the node to find nodes (equivalent to getNodes), but create nodes that would match if they do not exist.

Note that if this xpath ends in "**", the "**" is ignored. If this path has wildcards (i.e. "**") in any of its (other) elements, an exception will be thrown.

Returns:
the found or created nodes.
